alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 8:00AM CST until January 11 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...ICING ONGOING WITH MULTIPLE ACCIDENTS... .Freezing rain is slowly shifting east through central and northcentral Wisconsin but a layer of ice has resulted in very slick roads, sidewalks, and driveways if untreated. Some roads have been closed, including Interstate 94 since 6 am, where a multi-semi trailer accident has occurred. Law enforcement continues to report new accidents across western and central Wisconsin north of Interstate 90. There are still some slick spots and accidents in southeast Minnesota, but conditions are slowly improving there. In northcentral Wisconsin, north of highway 29, more of a mix with sleet and snow is expected. The precipitation will all slowly diminish through the morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Freezing rain leading to a glaze of ice up to 1/10 of an inch. Snow accumulations north of Highway 29 in northcentral Wisconsin of up to one inch. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
